article_title: Joe Rago: Inside the War Against Islamic State
article_text:
Washington

Some six months ago, the Islamic State terrorist army poured south from Syria through Iraq’s Tigris and Euphrates valleys, conquering multiple cities including Mosul and the border city of al Qaim. Iraqi army regulars disintegrated, the offensive carved out a rump state controlling somewhere between a quarter and one-third of Iraq’s sovereign territory, and mass executions, repression and videotaped beheadings...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Joe Rago interviews retired Marine Corps. Gen. John Allen, U.S. special envoy in the fight against Islamic State.
twitter.title: Inside the War Against Islamic State
